decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent. Reason: As required by Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

Prior to the commencement of development, samples of the facing materials to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, showing the proposed brick types, size, colour, texture, face bond and pointing proposed for any replacement bricks, as well as diagram to clearly show the location of the replacement bricks on the section of wall.The specification shall be submitted to the LPA and retained until details have been approved in writing.The development shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Unless otherwise approved through this listed building consent, all new work and improvements must match the existing (original) in terms of the choice of materials, method of construction and finished appearance (i.e. traditional hand methods only, using a lime mortar). Any existing bricks should be retained or re-used where possible. Any bricks to be removed must be cut out by hand. Any replacement bricks must be fully tied into the wall following the original bond.The mortar to be used in the development to which this consent relates shall be lime-based and shall match that of the original wall in terms of the coarseness of the aggregate, overall consistency, and finished colour, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The method of cleaning of the brickwork hereby approved as part of this permission shall be via water cleaning only and not by the use of chemicals, pressure or mechanical methods, and shall be carried out in full accordance with the water wash cleaning Method paragraph set out on Page 4 of the Heritage Statement, dated 18th March 2023.  Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.
